name: Django Software Foundation
description: Web framework for perfectionists with deadlines

projects.description: This proposal aims to provide more customisability to Django users in operations related to database indexes - their creation, modification. Another objective is to add support for creation of more complex indexes in Django using different methods (like RTree, Hash) on relevant backends (most notably PostgreSQL), such as functional indexes and indexes with different algorithms (e.g. GiST).
projects.short_description: This proposal aims to provide more customisability to Django users in operations related to database indexes - their creation, modification. Another...
projects.title: Reworking Django's Indexes

projects.description: Django currently has limited support for JSONField. The support is provided in contrib.postgres.fields module, meaning it can only be used for PostgreSQL database backend. Django officially supports PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB, SQLite, and Oracle Database backends. This project aims to add JSONField that can be used for all database backends supported by Django.
projects.short_description: Django currently has limited support for JSONField. The support is provided in contrib.postgres.fields module, meaning it can only be used for...
projects.title: Add Cross-DB JSONField

projects.description:
This project aims to improve the FormSet Class in Django, thus enhancing its functionality and ease of use.

Django currently has a formset class which is used as a collection instance for the forms. It’s a layer of abstraction which makes it easier to work with multiple forms.
projects.short_description:
This project aims to improve the FormSet Class in Django, thus enhancing its functionality and ease of use.
Django currently has a formset class...
projects.title: FormSet Improvements

projects.description: This project expands Django's parallel test runner to work on Windows and macOS by running the parallel test runner using spawn, and also adds Oracle backend support to using the parallel test runner.

projects.description: Django Stubs plugin supporting Mypy (static type checker) needs to be thoroughly refactored, or even partially rewritten. Getting rid of various stability issues and bugs will make it much more friendly to developers who use it, and will be a good foundation for further development of the whole project.

projects.description: This project aims at adding support for Redis to be used as a caching backend with Django. As redis is the most popular caching backend according to the django developer survey of 2020, adding it to django.core.cache module would be a great addition for the developers who previously had to rely on third party packages for this functionality.
projects.short_description: This project aims at adding support for Redis to be used as a caching backend with Django. As redis is the most popular caching backend according to...
projects.title: Adding a Redis cache backend to Django's core module

projects.description: The new implementation will consist of a central registry in ProjectState instances where all the related fields would be registered for all apps. Then significant changes in ProjectState, Schema Editor, and Operations' subclasses would be made in order to make all of them adapt ModelStates in spite of fake rendered models in a backward-compatible way. Then the new method mapping in ProjectState for all Operation subclasses' state_forwards and state_backwards would be introduced. And after all this, the traditional __fake__ model implementation would now be replaced with new ModelState implementation
projects.short_description: The new implementation will consist of a central registry in ProjectState instances where all the related fields would be registered for all apps....
projects.title: Adapt schema editors to operate from model states instead of fake rendered models during migrate phase

projects.description:
The goal of my project is to replace the current default database search backend in Wagtail, which is a dummy backend that comes enabled by default, with a functional one that works on SQLite, PostgreSQL, and MySQL.

My specific goals are:

  • Remove the contrib PostgreSQL backend that is currently defined, without making breaking changes that could affect current Wagtail installations.
  • Implement a new core search backend that is independent of the specific database system used, which acts as a bridge between the rest of the Wagtail apps and the database-specific backends.
  • Implement a specific backend, which is bridged to by the base core backend, for the PostgreSQL, SQLite, and MySQL database systems. It should take advantage of the specific FTS data types and functions that are defined in each one.
  • Document the code of the backends, both in the source code and in Wagtail’s documentation.
projects.short_description: The goal of my project is to replace the current default database search backend in Wagtail, which is a dummy backend that comes enabled by default,...
projects.title: New database search backend

projects.description: High speed content delivery from a messaging app to a Wagtail site.

projects.description: Currently, lookups could be registered to a Field class which limits the versatility of Django lookups. This project adds support for lookups (building blocks to filter from a database) to be registered and unregistered for a specific Field instance (representing a field of a database table). So Field-instance-specific lookups can now be done in Django!
projects.short_description: Currently, lookups could be registered to a Field class which limits the versatility of Django lookups. This project adds support for lookups...
projects.title: Per field-instance lookups

projects.description: The goal of this project is to allowing moving models between apps.. The model movement will be auto detected by a new generate_moved_model method in auto-detector to decrease the manual work load. The model will be moved using all the existing operations.

projects.title: Allow moving a model between apps

projects.description:
The ticket-32159 (https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/32519) originally requested a new feature to make Django provide generic database functions for manipulating JSON data on the database. Currently, in order to make partial updates to a JSONField, developers need tol oad model instance to the memory, modify JSONField data as objects, then call save() on the model instance, or write custom mapping for JSON functions as Func subclasses, and use them in update().

It would be better if Django has built-in support for doing partial JSONField updates more efficiently and more idiomatic to how developers can currently query JSONFields (i.e. with key transforms). In order to achieve that, this proposal intends to create an implementation for all databases supported that developers can use in order to update partial values of JSONField.

This project aims to accomplish the problem by dividing it into two big parts: first, implement JSONSet and JSONRemove functions to allow partial updates to JSONField. Second, add support for key transforms in update() for JSONField to make it easier to use for developers.

The project will be executed on creating JSONSet for SQLite, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle first, then, create JSONRemove on same databases. After that, support for key transform on update() will be implemented.
projects.short_description: The ticket-32159 (https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/32519) originally requested a new feature to make Django provide generic database functions...
projects.title: Add support for using key and path transforms in update() for JSONFields.

projects.description:
In database design, composite primary keys are often necessary for the partitioning and sharding of database tables.

- Citus is a PostgreSQL extension that transforms PostgreSQL into a distributed database.
- django-multitenant is a library by Citus which enables developers to build multi-tenant applications in Django.

In Citus, composite primary keys are required. So, in order to use these tools with Django, the developers must work around the Django ORM.

To make building multi-tenant apps easier, I propose adding composite primary key support to the Django ORM.

https://gist.github.com/csirmazbendeguz/de1fdf88bf9df0dfba837f8e88c35df6
projects.short_description: In database design, composite primary keys are often necessary for the partitioning and sharding of database tables. - Citus is a PostgreSQL...
projects.title: Django ORM support for composite primary keys

projects.description: This proposal aims to improve the django-admin-keyboard-shortcuts package by adding new keyboard shortcuts, fixing existing issues, and introducing a command palette to make the Django admin interface more accessible for keyboard-focused users. The goal is to refine this proof-of-concept package and integrate its features into Django core for built-in support.
projects.short_description: This proposal aims to improve the django-admin-keyboard-shortcuts package by adding new keyboard shortcuts, fixing existing issues, and introducing a...
projects.title: Django Admin: Add Keyboard Shortcuts and Command Palette

projects.description:
Django's template language currently lacks a built-in way to define and reuse small template fragments within the same file, a pattern beneficial for component-based design and partial page updates (e.g., using HTMX). This project aims to integrate the core functionality of the popular django-template-partials package into Django itself.
The solution involves introducing new built-in tags, {% partialdef name %}...{% endpartialdef %} for defining fragments and {% partial name %} for rendering them using the current context (with context modification handled via the standard {% with %} tag). Additionally, template loading functions (get_template, select_template, {% include %}) will be enhanced to support a template_name#partial_name syntax, allowing direct rendering of only the specified fragment. This will leverage Django 5.1's parser.extra_data API for storing compiled partials efficiently.
Deliverables include the implementation of the new tags and nodes, modifications to the template engine's loading mechanism, comprehensive tests, documentation for the new features and loading syntax, and a migration guide for users of the original third-party package.
projects.short_description: Django's template language currently lacks a built-in way to define and reuse small template fragments within the same file, a pattern beneficial for...
projects.title: Django Templates: Bring django-template-partials into core

projects.description: Django’s contribution workflow has several manual and repetitive processes that create bottlenecks for maintainers and contributors. These processes, ranging from ensuring coding style adherence to checking test coverage, commit message formatting, and proper deprecation handling, are error-prone and take up valuable time. This project aims to automate these workflows, reducing manual effort, improving contributor experience, and maintaining Django’s high-quality standards.
projects.short_description: Django’s contribution workflow has several manual and repetitive processes that create bottlenecks for maintainers and contributors. These processes,...
projects.title: Automate processes within Django contribution workflow
